document_name: Report on the Implementation of the Czech Trust Fund 2011_.pdf
Annual Report of Czech-UNDP Trust Fund
http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/SVK/00035692/Report on the Implementation of the Czech Trust Fund 2011_.pdf

outputs.output_descr: UNDP managed to establish an effectively used development cooperation mechanisms in ECIS region. The Czech-UNDP Trust Fund (CTF), based in Bratislava Regional Centre, Slovakia, supports socio-economic development activities that involve sharing of experience, good practices and lessons learned from Czech transition to democracy and market economy as well as to European Union membership. CTF is helping countries in the region of Balkans and CIS to improve their national systems and legislation in four priority sectors (environmental issues, HIV/AIDS prevention, economic transformation, good governance and democracy), conducting study trips to the Czech Republic, carrying on feasibility studies in beneficiary countries, organizing workshops, and providing individual consultations. It also strenghtens professional capacities of Czech ODA.

project_descr: Triangular development cooperation in ECIS countries aimed at transfer of the best Czech experience in the field of environmental protection, good/local governance, economic transformation and HIV/AIDS prevention.
